remarks: Given any set, the Hartogs number of the set is the least ordinal not dominated by that set.  This theorem proves that there is always an ordinal which satisfies this.  (This theorem can be proven trivially using the AC - see theorem ~ ondomon - but this proof works in ZF.) (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 22-Oct-2009.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-May-2015.)
statement:
hartogs $p |- ( A e. V -> { x e. On | x ~<_ A } e. On ) $.
$d A x $.
